ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.11'

about.description:
gplearn is purposefully constrained to solving symbolic regression
problems. gplearn retains the familiar scikit-learn fit/predict API
and works with the existing scikit-learn pipeline and grid search modules.
gplearn is built for Python 3.11+ and requires scikit-learn
about.summary: gplearn implements Genetic Programming in Python, with a scikit-learn inspired and compatible API

about.description:
gplearn is purposefully constrained to solving symbolic regression
problems. gplearn retains the familiar scikit-learn fit/predict API
and works with the existing scikit-learn pipeline and grid search modules.
gplearn is built for Python 3.11+ and requires scikit-learn
about.summary: gplearn implements Genetic Programming in Python, with a scikit-learn inspired and compatible API

name: gplearn
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "gplearn" %}
{% set version = "0.4.3" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/trevorstephens/{{ name }}/archive/{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: f9076f105e00c20aee9dc4c18e68ee537309d9c8294b49bbc75caa87fdab7d0f

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - hatchling
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - scikit-learn >=1.8.0
    - joblib >=1.3.0

test:
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
  imports:
    - gplearn

about:
  home: https://github.com/trevorstephens/gplearn/
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: gplearn implements Genetic Programming in Python, with a scikit-learn inspired and compatible API

  description: |
    gplearn is purposefully constrained to solving symbolic regression
    problems. gplearn retains the familiar scikit-learn fit/predict API
    and works with the existing scikit-learn pipeline and grid search modules.
    gplearn is built for Python 3.11+ and requires scikit-learn
  doc_url: https://gplearn.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/trevorstephens/gplearn/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - trevorstephens
    - owenlamont
